title: Praying mantis chomping on a live stink bug turns its head to stare at two women watching it
text:
This is the moment a praying mantis eerily turns its head to stare back at two women who were watching it eat a live bug on the outside of a window.

The footage, filmed in the US, captures a dental worker and her colleague as they watch the scene unfold from inside an office on their lunch break.

Outside a window, a praying mantis is perched on the glass with a stink bug in its arms, slowly chomping at the live insect.

The footage, filmed in the US, captures a dental worker and her colleague as they watch a praying mantis eat a live stink bug on their lunch break

It continues to consume its catch as the short clip continues, and the two women chat excitedly about the scene they are witnessing. One of the pair even compares it to the film Predator.

But moments later, the insect notices it has an audience, and suddenly turns its head to stare at the two colleagues.

As it moves, the dental workers gasp, with one exclaiming 'I can't believe he just looked at you' while the other shouts 'Oh my God'.

Taking to social media, the father of the camerawoman said: 'My daughter works at a dentist office.

But moments later, the insect notices it has an audience, and suddenly turns its head to stare at the two colleagues (right)

'She and her co-worker were taking their lunch break and noticed this praying mantis eating a stink bug while it was still alive.

'The girls thought this was awesome. She takes after her Dad! Oh, and the end is the best part!'

The praying mantis, named for its prominent front legs, is a carnivore which largely preys on moths, crickets, grasshoppers and flies.
description: The footage, filmed in the US, captures a dental worker and her colleague as they watch a praying mantis eat a live stink bug through a window on their lunch break.
